user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ObjectIdFindByName:
```c
int32 OS_ObjectIdFindByName(osal_objtype_t idtype, const char *name, osal_id_t *object_id)
{
    int32             return_code;
    OS_object_token_t token;

    /*
     * As this is an internal-only function, calling it with NULL is allowed.
     * This is required by the file/dir/socket API since these DO allow multiple
     * instances of the same name.
     */
    ARGCHECK(name, OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND);
    LENGTHCHECK(name, OS_MAX_API_NAME, OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetByName(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, idtype, name, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        *object_id = token.obj_id;

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        *object_id = token.obj_id;

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the if-block is conditionally reachable when return_code == OS_SUCCESS (return_code is assigned from OS_ObjectIdGetByName). There is nothing in the fragment that makes it unreachable. Only if OS_ObjectIdGetByName were provably guaranteed to never return OS_SUCCESS (or if OS_SUCCESS were impossible) would the block be unreachable, which would require inspection of that function/definitions.
